003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

005 * "Simplified" License (see http://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-2-Clause).

008 ******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.image;
010
011import java.awt.BasicStroke;
012import java.awt.Color;
013import java.awt.Graphics;
014import java.awt.Graphics2D;
015import java.awt.RenderingHints;
016import java.awt.Shape;
017import java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D;
018import java.awt.geom.Line2D;
019import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
020import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
021import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
022import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
023
024import ij.process.Blitter;
025import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
026import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
027import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
028import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
029import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
030import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
031
032/**
033 * <p>This class defines functionality for drawing anti-aliased "pixel"
034 * graphics in images of type 
035 * {@link ByteProcessor},
036 * {@link ShortProcessor} or
037 * {@link ColorProcessor}
038 * (there is no support for {@link FloatProcessor}).
039 * It uses the capabilities of AWT's {@link Graphics2D} class
040 * by drawing to a {@link BufferedImage}, which is a copy of
041 * the original image. After performing the drawing operations
042 * the {@link BufferedImage} is copied back to the original.
043 * Thus all operations possible on a {@link Graphics2D} instance
044 * are available, including the drawing of {@link Shape}
045 * objects with floating-point coordinates, arbitrary 
046 * strokes and anti-aliasing, which is not available with
047 * ImageJ's built-in graphics operations (for class {@link ImageProcessor}).
048 * </p>
049 * <p>
050 * Since drawing involves copying the image multiple times, graphic operations
051 * should be grouped for efficiency reasons.
052 * Here is an example for the intended form of use:
053 * </p>
054 * <pre>
055 * ImageProcessor ip = ... ;   // some ByteProcessor, ShortProcessor or ColorProcessor
056 * try (ImageGraphics ig = new ImageGraphics(ip)) {
057 *      ig.setColor(255);
058 *      ig.setLineWidth(1.0);
059 *      ig.drawLine(40, 100.5, 250, 101.5);
060 *      ig.drawOval(230.6, 165.2, 150, 150);
061 *      ...
062 * }</pre>
063 * <p>
064 * Note the use of <code>double</code> coordinates throughout.
065 * The original image ({@code ip} in the above example) is automatically updated 
066 * at the end of the {@code try() ...} clause (by {@link ImageGraphics} implementing the
067 * {@link AutoCloseable} interface).
068 * The {@link #getGraphics2D()} method exposes the underlying 
069 * {@link Graphics2D} instance of the {@link ImageGraphics} object, which can then be used to
070 * perform arbitrary AWT graphic operations.
071 * Thus, the above example could <strong>alternatively</strong> be implemented as follows:
072 * <pre>
073 * ImageProcessor ip = ... ;   // some ByteProcessor, ShortProcessor or ColorProcessor
074 * try (ImageGraphics ig = new ImageGraphics(ip)) {
075 *      Graphics2D g2 = ig.getGraphics2D();
076 *      g2.setColor(Color.white);
077 *      g2.setStroke(new BasicStroke(1.0f));
078 *      g2.draw(new Line2D.Double(40, 100.5, 250, 101.5));
079 *      g2.draw(new Ellipse2D.Double(230.6, 165.2, 150, 150));
080 *      ...
081 * }</pre>
082 * <p>
083 * This class also defines several convenience methods for drawing
084 * shapes with floating-point ({@code double}) coordinates, as well as for
085 * setting colors and stroke parameters.
086 * If intermediate updates are needed (e.g., for animations), the {@code update()} method
087 * can be invoked any time.
088 * </p>
089 * 
090 * @author WB
091 * @version 2020-01-07
092 * 
093 * @see ShapeOverlayAdapter
094 */
095public class ImageGraphics implements AutoCloseable {
096        
097        // TODO: Add text drawing, merge with {@link ColoredStroke}.
098        
099        private static BasicStroke DEFAULT_STROKE = new BasicStroke();
100        private static Color DEFAULT_COLOR = Color.white;
101        private static boolean DEFAULT_ANTIALIASING = true;
102        
103        private ImageProcessor ip;
104        private BufferedImage bi;
105        private final Graphics2D g2;
106        
107        private BasicStroke stroke = DEFAULT_STROKE;
108        private Color color = DEFAULT_COLOR;
109        
110        // -------------------------------------------------------------
111        
112        /**
113         * Constructor. The supplied image must be of type
114         * {@link ByteProcessor}, {@link ShortProcessor} or 
115         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
116         * An {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown for images
117         * of type {@link FloatProcessor}.
118         * 
119         * @param ip image to draw on
120         */
121        public ImageGraphics(ImageProcessor ip) {
122                this(ip, null, null);
123        }
124        
125        /**
126         * Constructor. The supplied image must be of type
127         * {@link ByteProcessor}, {@link ShortProcessor} or 
128         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
129         * An {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown for images
130         * of type {@link FloatProcessor}.
131         * 
132         * @param ip image to draw on
133         * @param color the initial drawing color
134         * @param stroke the initial stroke
135         */
136        public ImageGraphics(ImageProcessor ip, Color color, BasicStroke stroke) {
137                this.ip = ip;
138                this.bi = toBufferedImage(ip);  // throws exception when ip is a ShortProcessor
139                
140                if (color != null) this.color = color;
141                if (stroke != null) this.stroke = stroke;
142                
143                this.g2 = (Graphics2D) bi.getGraphics();
144                this.g2.setColor(color);
145                this.g2.setColor(this.color);
146                this.g2.setStroke(this.stroke);
147                this.setAntialiasing(DEFAULT_ANTIALIASING);
148        }
149        
150        /**
151         * Turn anti-aliasing on/off for this {@link ImageGraphics} instance
152         * (turned on by default). The new setting will only affect
153         * subsequent graphics operations.
154         * 
155         * @param onoff set true to turn on
156         */
157        public void setAntialiasing(boolean onoff) {
158                g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING, onoff ? 
159                                RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_ON : RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_OFF);
160                g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_TEXT_ANTIALIASING, onoff ?
161                                RenderingHints.VALUE_TEXT_ANTIALIAS_ON : RenderingHints.VALUE_TEXT_ANTIALIAS_OFF);
162        }
163        
164        /**
165         * Returns the underlying {@link Graphics2D} object,
166         * which can be used to perform arbitrary graphics operations.
167         * @return the {@link Graphics2D} object
168         */
169        public Graphics2D getGraphics2D() {
170                return this.g2;
171        }
172        
173        /**
174         * Forces the image to be updated by copying the (modified)
175         * {@link BufferedImage} back to the input image.
176         * There is usually no need to call this (expensive) method explicitly.
177         * It is called automatically and only once at end of the 
178         * {@code try() ...} clause, as described in the {@link ImageGraphics}
179         * class documentation above.
180         */
181        public void update() {
182                copyImageToProcessor(bi, ip);
183        }
184
185        @Override
186        public void close() {
187                update();
188                ip = null;
189                bi = null;
190        }
191        
192        // -----------------------------------------------------------
193        
194        // Needed, since IJ's conversion methods are not named consistently.
195        private BufferedImage toBufferedImage(ImageProcessor ip) {
196                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor) {
197                        return ((ByteProcessor) ip).getBufferedImage(); 
198                }
199                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor) {
200                        return ((ShortProcessor) ip).get16BitBufferedImage(); 
201                }
202                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
203                        return ((ColorProcessor) ip).getBufferedImage();
204                }
205                else {
206                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot create BufferedImage from " +
207                                        ip.getClass().getName());
208                }
209        }
210        
211        /**
212         * Copies the contents of the {@link BufferedImage} to the specified 
213         * {@link ImageProcessor}. The size and type of the BufferedImage
214         * is assumed to match the ImageProcessor.
215         * 
216         * @param bi the local (intermediate) {@link BufferedImage} instance
217         * @param ip the original {@link ImageProcessor}
218         */
219        private void copyImageToProcessor(BufferedImage bi, ImageProcessor ip) {
220                ImageProcessor ip2 = null;
221                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor) {
222                        ip2 = new ByteProcessor(bi); 
223                }
224                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor) {
225                        ip2 = new ShortProcessor(bi); 
226                }
227                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
228                        ip2 = new ColorProcessor(bi); 
229                }
230                else {
231                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot create BufferedImage from " +
232                                        ip.getClass().getName());
233                }
234                ip.copyBits(ip2, 0, 0, Blitter.COPY);
235        }
236        
237        // -----------------------------------------------------------
238        //  Convenience methods for drawing selected shapes with double coordinates
239        // -----------------------------------------------------------
240        
241        /**
242         * Draws a straight line segment specified with
243         * {@code double} coordinate values (convenience method).
244         * @param x1 x-coordinate of start point
245         * @param y1 y-coordinate of start point
246         * @param x2 x-coordinate of end point
247         * @param y2 y-coordinate of end point
248         * @see Line2D
249         */
250        public void drawLine(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2) {
251                g2.draw(new Line2D.Double(x1, y1, x2, y2));
252        }
253        
254        /**
255         * Draws an ellipse specified with
256         * {@code double} coordinate values (convenience method).
257         * @param x x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle
258         * @param y y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the framing rectangle
259         * @param w width
260         * @param h height
261         * @see Ellipse2D
262         */
263        public void drawOval(double x, double y, double w, double h) {
264                g2.draw(new Ellipse2D.Double(x, y, w, h));
265        }
266        
267        /**
268         * Draws a rectangle specified with
269         * {@code double} coordinate values (convenience method).
270         * @param x x-coordinate of the upper-left corner
271         * @param y y-coordinate of the upper-left corner
272         * @param w width
273         * @param h height
274         * @see Rectangle2D
275         */
276        public void drawRectangle(double x, double y, double w, double h) {
277                g2.draw(new Rectangle2D.Double(x, y, w, h));
278        }
279        
280        /**
281         * Draws a closed polygon specified by a 
282         * sequence of {@link Point2D} objects with arbitrary coordinate values
283         * (convenience method).
284         * Note that the the polygon is automatically closed, i.e.,
285         * N+1 segments are drawn if the number of given points is N.
286         * @param points a sequence of 2D points
287         * @see Path2D
288         */
289        public void drawPolygon(Point2D ... points) {
290                Path2D.Double p = new Path2D.Double();
291                p.moveTo(points[0].getX(), points[0].getY());
292                for (int i = 1; i < points.length; i++) {
293                        p.lineTo(points[i].getX(), points[i].getY());
294                }
295                p.closePath();
296                g2.draw(p);
297        }
298        
299        // stroke-related methods -------------------------------------
300        
301        /**
302         * Sets this graphics context's current color to the specified color. 
303         * All subsequent graphics operations using this graphics context use 
304         * this specified color.
305         * @param color the new rendering color
306         * @see Graphics#setColor
307         */
308        public void setColor(Color color) {
309                this.color = color;
310                g2.setColor(color);
311        }
312        
313        /**
314         * Sets this graphics context's current color to the specified
315         * (gray) color, with RGB = (gray, gray, gray).
316         * @param gray the gray value
317         */
318        public void setColor(int gray) {
319                if (gray < 0) gray = 0;
320                if (gray > 255) gray = 255;
321                this.setColor(new Color(gray, gray, gray));
322        }
323        
324        /**
325         * Sets the stroke to be used for all subsequent graphics operations.
326         * @param stroke a {@link BasicStroke} instance
327         * @see BasicStroke
328         */
329        public void setStroke(BasicStroke stroke) {
330                this.stroke = stroke;
331                g2.setStroke(this.stroke);
332        }
333        
334        /**
335         * Sets the line width of the current stroke.
336         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
337         * @param width the line width
338         * @see BasicStroke
339         */
340        public void setLineWidth(double width) {
341                this.stroke = new BasicStroke((float)width, stroke.getEndCap(), stroke.getLineJoin());
342                g2.setStroke(this.stroke);
343        }
344        
345        /**
346         * Sets the end cap style of the current stroke to "BUTT".
347         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
348         * @see BasicStroke
349         */
350        public void setEndCapButt() {
351                this.setEndCap(BasicStroke.CAP_BUTT);
352        }
353        
354        /**
355         * Sets the end cap style of the current stroke to "ROUND".
356         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
357         * @see BasicStroke
358         */
359        public void setEndCapRound() {
360                this.setEndCap(BasicStroke.CAP_ROUND);
361        }
362        
363        /**
364         * Sets the end cap style of the current stroke to "SQUARE".
365         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
366         * @see BasicStroke
367         */
368        public void setEndCapSquare() {
369                this.setEndCap(BasicStroke.CAP_SQUARE);
370        }
371        
372        private void setEndCap(int cap) {
373                setStroke(new BasicStroke(stroke.getLineWidth(), cap, stroke.getLineJoin()));
374        }
375        
376        // ---------------------
377        
378        /**
379         * Sets the line segment join style of the current stroke to "BEVEL".
380         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
381         * @see BasicStroke
382         */
383        public void setLineJoinBevel() {
384                setLineJoin(BasicStroke.JOIN_BEVEL);
385        }
386        
387        /**
388         * Sets the line segment join style of the current stroke to "MITER".
389         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
390         * @see BasicStroke
391         */
392        public void setLineJoinMiter() {
393                setLineJoin(BasicStroke.JOIN_MITER);
394        }
395        
396        /**
397         * Sets the line segment join style of the current stroke to "ROUND".
398         * All other stroke properties remain unchanged.
399         * @see BasicStroke
400         */
401        public void setLineJoinRound() {
402                setLineJoin(BasicStroke.JOIN_ROUND);
403        }
404        
405        private void setLineJoin(int join) {
406                setStroke(new BasicStroke(stroke.getLineWidth(), stroke.getEndCap(), join));
407        }
408}
